p: The largest percentage increase in P pl and I, relative to individuals from the next deepest soil layer, occurred in plants germinated from the 12–14 cm (L3) soil layer (Fig. 3). When these were plotted against the rate of population expansion for G. tinctoria, gained from distribution records (Preston et al. 2002), the greatest change was observed to have occurred during the transition from the lag to the exponential range expansion phases. The largest percentage increase in N l, relative to individuals from the next deepest soil layer, occurred in plants germinated from the 4–6 cm (L2) soil layer (Fig. 3).
